oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Live from the Grand Ole Opry - 1965-11-27
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of a variety of live shows from the Grand Ole Opry. The recordings feature artist performances by: the Osborne Brothers (musical group), Jimmy Wilson (musician), Benny Martin (musical), Roy Acuff (musical), Bill Anderson (musician), Stringbean (musician), Bobby Bare (musician), and Jimmy C. Newman (musician). The first show is from November 27, 1965. The Luzianne show is from January 29, 1966. The remaining recordings are from a group of unidentified dates. The tape is labeled the third of thirteen.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Osborne Brothers; Jimmy Wilson; Benny Martin; Roy Acuff; Bill Anderson; Stringbean; Bobby Bare; Jimmy C. Newman
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The Osborne Brothers introduce "Take This Sledge" (00:21) Take This Sledge (Osborne Brothers) -- (02:41) Yakety Ax (Jimmy Wilson) -- (04:46) Today Has Been a Lonesome Day (Osborne Brothers) -- (07:32) Foggy Mountain Breakdown (Sammy Osborne) -- (09:05) Lava Soap Jingle [incomplete] ([Unidentified]) -- (09:30) Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff to plug the Grand Ole Opry and Don Reno -- (11:08) Greg Eagle Hornpipe (Benny Martin) -- (13:45) Nobody's Business (Benny Martin) -- (15:21) Unidentified tune (Roy Acuff) -- (15:46) Turner introduces Roy Acuff to discuss his record shop -- (16:33) Will the Circle be Unbroken (Roy Acuff) -- (19:13) Unidentified tune [featuring Turner outro comment voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (19:57) A Thing Called Sadness -- (20:06) An unidentified host introduces the Luzianne Grand Ole Opry -- (20:31) Luzianne Jingle [featuring Turner voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (21:09) Worried Man Blues (Bill Anderson) -- (23:31) Crazy Vietnam War (Stringbean) -- (26:30) 500 Miles Away From Home (Bobby Bare) -- (27:43) Martha White Theme [featuring Grant Turner voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (28:51) Alligator Man (Jimmy C. Newman)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Osborne Brothers; Wilson, Jimmy (Pianist); Martin, Benny; Acuff, Roy; Anderson, Bill, 1937-; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Bare, Bobby; Newman, Jimmy C.;
